subtitle: A delicious choc and orange mixture. Serve well chilled in slices.

method.text: Preheat oven to 180°C.  Line a 28 x 20 cm Swiss roll tin with baking parchment.
Whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale. Fold in the melted chocolate. Whisk egg whites until stiff and fold in. Pour into tin and smooth surface.
Bake  for 25-35 min. Remove from oven and cover with a clean damp tea towel. Cool.
To make the filling: Grate rind and squeeze juice from orange. Add sugar, stir to dissolve. Add 300 ml / <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> pint of the double cream and whisk until stiff.

Place a sheet of greaseproof paper on a worktop, sprinkle with icing sugar. Turn roulade onto paper. Spread with cream filling. Roll up, like a Swiss roll, using paper to help. Serve with remaining double cream.

title: Chocolate and orange roulade
